home.heroDescription: Deploy agents that deliver. Browser automation, domain search, and more. Use any AI model securely-no middleman, no fees, no data stored. Powered by real-world tools and macros via MCP.
home.demoTitle: Turn Any Browser Action & Data Extraction into an AI Tool in 60 Seconds
home.demoDesc: Watch how to create and run browser macros with izan.io
home.compSubtitle: Traditional AI assistants like OpenClaw install on your machine and control your entire computer - shell commands, file system, everything. izan.io takes a fundamentally different approach.
home.compServerlessDesc: No server to install, no CLI to configure, no dependencies to manage. Open izan.io in your browser and start working. That's it.
home.compSecurityTitle: Your Keys Never Leave Your Browser
home.compSecurityDesc: API keys are stored in your browser's IndexedDB - never sent to any server. No middleman, no data collection, no trust required.
home.compSandboxDesc: Traditional assistants get full shell access to your machine. izan.io only automates your browser - it can't read your files, run commands, or modify your system.
home.compOpenDesc: AGPL-3.0 licensed. Bring any of 17+ AI providers. Switch models freely. Your data, your rules, your agents.
home.compVsRow1Traditional: Install locally, configure CLI, manage dependencies
home.compVsRow2Traditional: Full computer control: shell, files, system
home.compVsRow3Izan: Browser IndexedDB only - never leaves your device
home.compVsRow4Traditional: Can execute any command on your machine
home.compVsRow5Izan: Visual macro recording, no code needed
home.compVsRow6Traditional: Needs open APIs or custom integrations
home.compVsRow6Izan: Log in normally - automate any site you can access
home.compAuthDesc: Just log into any website in your browser session and automate it. No MCP server needed, no open APIs required. If you can access it, izan.io can automate it.
home.compCtaTitle: Open izan.io. Install the extension. That's it.
home.compCtaDesc: No accounts, no servers, no configuration. Start automating in seconds.
home.featSectionTitle: Everything You Need to Build AI Workflows
home.featSectionDesc: From browser automation to scheduled tasks - all the tools to make AI agents work for you.
home.featAgentsTitle: AI Agent Platform with Multi-Agent Orchestration
home.featAgentsDesc: Chain multiple AI agents together for complex workflows. One agent delegates to others - research, analyze, and execute in parallel.

agents.title: AI Agents
agents.description: Agents integrated with MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers. Each agent provides access to different tools and automates tasks.
agents.createPlain: A blank agent will be created. You can customize it later.
agents.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this agent?
agents.resetConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset this agent to its default settings?
agents.name: Name
agents.basePromptPlaceholder: Prompt defining the agent's base behavior...
agents.modelParamsDesc: Control how this agent generates responses. Leave empty to use defaults.
agents.temperatureDesc: Higher values (e.g. 1.0) make output more creative and varied. Lower values (e.g. 0.2) make it more focused and deterministic. Range: 0–2.
agents.maxTokensDesc: Maximum length of the response. Higher values allow longer answers but cost more. Leave empty for provider default.
agents.topPDesc: Nucleus sampling: only considers tokens in the top P probability mass. Lower = more focused. Range: 0–1.
agents.maxIterationsDesc: Maximum LLM rounds per message. Each round is one LLM call - tool calls, text responses, and continuation nudges all count. Range: 1–100.

general.name: General Assistant
general.description: General purpose AI assistant. Helps with any topic.
general.detailedDescription: Your everyday AI companion. The General Assistant handles a wide range of tasks - from quick calculations and time checks to generating secure passwords and unique identifiers. Think of it as your smart utility belt: always ready, always helpful, no setup required.
general.whatItDoes: The General Assistant comes with built-in utility tools that let it go beyond simple conversation. It can tell you the current time, perform mathematical calculations, generate cryptographically secure passwords, create UUIDs, and produce random numbers. It's the perfect starting point for anyone new to izan.io.
general.feature1: Instant time and date lookups across timezones
general.feature2: Mathematical calculations from simple arithmetic to complex expressions
general.feature3: Secure password generation with customizable length and complexity
general.feature4: UUID and random number generation for development and testing
general.howToUse: Just start chatting naturally. Ask a question, request a calculation, or ask for a password - the assistant automatically picks the right tool. No configuration needed.
general.proTip: You can combine multiple requests in one message. For example: "Generate a UUID, create a 20-character password, and calculate 15% of 2499."
general.usageExample3: Generate a secure 24-character password with symbols
general.usageExample4: Create 5 UUIDs for my database records

web-fetch.name: Web Fetch
web-fetch.description: Web fetch assistant. Navigate to any web page and read its content.
web-fetch.detailedDescription: Your go-to agent for reading web pages. The Web Fetch agent opens a real browser tab via the Chrome extension, navigates to any URL, and returns the full accessibility tree of the page. Perfect for reading articles, checking documentation, or extracting information from any website.
web-fetch.whatItDoes: The Web Fetch agent uses the Chrome extension to open a browser tab, navigate to any URL, wait for the page to fully load, and return the complete accessibility tree. This gives you structured, readable content from any web page without CORS restrictions.
web-fetch.feature1: Fetch any web page - no CORS restrictions
web-fetch.feature2: Full accessibility tree with semantic structure
web-fetch.feature3: Real browser rendering via Chrome extension
web-fetch.feature4: No API key required - uses your browser
web-fetch.howToUse: Provide a URL and the agent will open it in a browser tab, wait for it to load, and return the page content as a structured accessibility tree. You can ask questions about the content or request specific pages.
web-fetch.proTip: The agent opens real browser tabs - make sure the Chrome extension is installed and active for this agent to work.
web-fetch.usageExample2: What does the React documentation say about hooks?
web-fetch.usageExample3: Read the content of this page: https://news.ycombinator.com
web-fetch.usageExample4: Summarize the article at this URL
web-fetch.usageExample5: What information is on this page?

domain-expert.name: Domain Expert
domain-expert.description: Creative domain name suggestions with instant availability checking. No API key required.

x-manager.name: X Manager
x-manager.description: Automate X/Twitter: post, like, retweet, follow, search, scrape profiles, and more. No Twitter API key needed.
x-manager.detailedDescription: Your X (formerly Twitter) automation assistant. This agent controls X.com directly through the browser using the izan.io Chrome extension - no Twitter API keys or developer accounts required. It can post tweets, like and retweet posts, follow and unfollow users, search tweets, scrape profiles and timelines, check trending topics, send DMs, manage bookmarks, and monitor notifications. Everything runs in your browser session, so your credentials stay local and private.
x-manager.whatItDoes: The X Manager agent uses 21 pre-built browser automation macros to interact with X.com through the Chrome extension. It navigates to the right pages, waits for content to load, and uses X.com's stable data-testid selectors to perform actions and extract data. Bulk tools run in parallel browser tabs for speed. No API keys, no rate limit tokens, no developer account needed - it works through the browser just like you would.
x-manager.mcps: Browser Extension (X/Twitter automation macros - 21 tools, including 6 parallel bulk tools)
x-manager.feature1: Post tweets (with 280-char validation), reply, like, retweet, and bookmark - all through browser automation, no Twitter API key required
x-manager.feature2: Parallel bulk operations: scrape multiple profiles, search multiple queries, like/retweet/follow many items simultaneously in parallel browser tabs
x-manager.feature3: Search tweets with advanced operators, scrape user profiles (bio, followers, location), extract timelines with engagement metrics, monitor trending topics
x-manager.feature4: Send direct messages, check notifications, manage bookmarks, follow/unfollow users - runs entirely in your browser via the Chrome extension
x-manager.howToUse: Install the izan.io Chrome extension, then select the X Manager agent and start chatting. Ask it to post a tweet, search for topics, check trending, scrape a profile, or perform any X/Twitter action. The agent opens X.com in a browser tab, performs the action, and returns the results. You must be logged into X.com in your browser.
x-manager.proTip: For bulk operations, just ask naturally: 'Compare the profiles of @openai, @anthropic, and @google' - the agent will use bulk_scrape_profiles to fetch all three in parallel. Use X search operators like from:user, min_faves:100, or lang:en for precise results.
x-manager.usageExample1: Post a tweet about our latest product launch
x-manager.usageExample3: Search for 'AI agents', 'open source LLM' and 'browser automation' in parallel
x-manager.usageExample4: What's trending on X right now?
x-manager.usageExample5: Like and retweet these tweets: url1, url2, url3

play-store.name: Play Store
play-store.description: Search and analyze apps on Google Play Store using browser automation.
play-store.detailedDescription: Your Play Store research assistant. This agent uses browser automation macros to search the Google Play Store and fetch detailed app information. It can find apps by name, category, or description and retrieve download counts, ratings, and app details.
play-store.whatItDoes: The Play Store agent uses pre-built browser automation macros via the Chrome extension to navigate Google Play Store pages. It can search for apps and scrape detailed information including descriptions, download stats, ratings, and more.
play-store.feature1: Search apps by name, category, or description
play-store.feature2: Fetch detailed app info including ratings and downloads
play-store.feature3: Automated browsing via Chrome extension macros
play-store.feature4: No API key required - uses browser automation
play-store.howToUse: Ask about any app or search the Play Store. The agent will use browser automation to navigate to Google Play Store, search for apps, and extract detailed information. Results include app names, descriptions, download counts, and ratings.
play-store.proTip: Make sure the Chrome extension is installed. You can search by app name or browse by category. For detailed info, provide the app package ID (e.g. com.example.app).
play-store.usageExample1: Search for weather apps on Play Store
play-store.usageExample2: Get details about the WhatsApp app
play-store.usageExample4: What are the best note-taking apps?
play-store.usageExample5: Look up com.spotify.music on Play Store

linkedin-manager.name: LinkedIn Manager
linkedin-manager.description: Automate LinkedIn: search people, scrape profiles, send connections, message contacts, and search jobs. No LinkedIn API needed.
linkedin-manager.detailedDescription: Your LinkedIn automation assistant. This agent controls LinkedIn directly through the browser using the izan.io Chrome extension - no LinkedIn API keys or developer accounts required.
